title: Marcy Kaptur - Wikipedia
snippet: In the 2000s, Kaptur sought to steer the Democratic Party towards a greater focus on its working-class base and sought a leadership role by emphasizing her Midwestern "heartland" roots in contrast to the party's coastal leadership. In 2002, she challenged Representative Nancy Pelosi for the position of House Democratic leader, using her candidacy to draw attention to what she described as the party's neglect of its "non-money wing." She withdrew before a vote was taken.

title: Marcy Kaptur - Ballotpedia
snippet: Incumbent Marcy Kaptur is running in the Democratic primary for U.S. House Ohio District 9 on May 5, 2026. title: About Marcy | Congresswoman Marcy Kaptur
snippet: In 1981, while pursuing a doctorate in urban planning and development finance at MIT, she was recruited by the Lucas County Democratic Party to run for Congress against a first-term Republican. Although she was outspent by a 3-to-1 margin, Kaptur parlayed a strong economic message during the 1982 recession to stage a nationally-recognized upset.

title: Rep. Marcy Kaptur [D-OH9, 1983-2026], Representative for Ohio's 9th Congressional District - GovTrack.us
snippet: Legislative Preview Dec. 15, 2025: Congress's Last Week of Work of the Year » ... Kaptur is the representative for Ohio’s 9th congressional district (view map) and is a Democrat. She has served since Jan. 3, 1983. Kaptur is next up for reelection in 2026 and serves until Jan.
